Spatial Multimodal Topic Model (sMTM) for single-cell spatial data analysis.

Source: R/sMTM.R
sMTM.Rd

This class implements a Spatial Multimodal Topic Model (sMTM) designed for analyzing single-cell spatial data across multiple modalities. The model captures spatial relationships by constructing a spatial neighborhood graph and uses Variational Inference (VI) to identify spatially-aware topics. These topics represent patterns across features and modalities while incorporating spatial information.

sMTM(
  object,
  n_topics = 20,
  radius = 0.05,
  n_neighbors = NULL,
  cache_similarities = FALSE,
  seed = 2291,
  n_jobs = -1
)

Arguments

object

A Seurat object containing multimodal single-cell spatial data, including spatial coordinates in the obsm attribute.

n_topics

Number of topics to infer. Each topic represents a distinct spatial pattern across features and modalities. Default is 20.

radius

Radius for constructing a spatial neighborhood graph. Used if n_neighbors is None. Default is 0.05.

n_neighbors

Number of neighbors to consider when constructing the spatial neighborhood graph. Overrides radius if set. Default is NULL.

cache_similarities

If TRUE, caches spatial similarity information for each update during Variational Inference. Default is FALSE.

seed

Random seed for reproducibility. Ensures consistent initialization and results. Default is 2291.

n_jobs

Number of CPU cores to use for parallel processing. If set to -1, uses all available cores. Default is -1.

Value

A new Seurat object.

Contents
